Run iOS Shortcuts from **SSH**, the **command line**, or **RemoteCompanion** — without ever opening the Shortcuts app.

Shortcuts execute headlessly via WorkflowKit in SpringBoard, so multi-action shortcuts run **fully and silently** in the background. Includes full RemoteCompanion integration with searchable shortcut picker and one-tap execution.

```
springcuts -r "My Shortcut"         # Run a shortcut
springcuts -r "My Shortcut" -i      # Run invisibly (no UI)
springcuts -r "My Shortcut" -w      # Wait for completion
springcuts -r "My Shortcut" -p "X"  # Run with text input
springcuts -l                        # List all shortcuts
springcuts -s                        # Stop running shortcuts
```

- All shortcut execution routes through WorkflowKit — full multi-action support
- RemoteCompanion uses Darwin notification dispatch instead of URL scheme
- `-i` (invisible) and `-w` (wait) flags now functional
- Refresh button works from within RemoteCompanion sandbox

- Shortcut list auto-populates on install
- Pull-to-refresh and refresh button in RemoteCompanion
- Direct shortcut firing from RemoteCompanion (bypasses broken TCP path)
- Rootless path detection fix for SpringBoard

- Initial rootless port for NathanLR / iOS 17.0
- Basic CLI and RemoteCompanion integration
